articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian officials threatened the West on Sunday with a "severe" response in the event that frozen Russian assets are confiscated, promising "endless" legal challenges and tit-for-tat measures.
articles.title: Russia threatens West with severe response if its assets are touched

articles.author: Serhiy Chalyi
articles.description: Oleksandr Taran's mobile artillery unit isn't officially part of Ukraine's military, but that hasn't stopped his men from destroying Russian targets on their own dime.
articles.title: Ukrainian 'Grandpa' leads over-60s unit fighting Russian forces for free

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's coast guard confronted Japanese lawmakers in waters claimed by both countries in the East China Sea, China's embassy in Tokyo and Japanese media said on Sunday, the latest in a series of maritime disputes involving China and its neighbours.
articles.title: China confronts Japanese politicians in disputed East China Sea area

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas said on Sunday only the United States could stop Israel attacking the border city of Rafah in Gaza, adding that the assault, which he expects within days, could force much of the Palestinian population to flee the enclave.
articles.title: Abbas says only US can halt Israel's attack on Rafah, expected in days

articles.author: John Irish
articles.description: France's foreign minister said that he would discuss proposals with Lebanese officials on Sunday aimed at easing tensions between Hezbollah and Israel and preventing a war breaking out.
articles.title: France pushes efforts in Lebanon to prevent war between Hezbollah and Israel

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Schools in Bangladesh reopened on Sunday despite a heatwave continuing to sweep the South Asian nation, with temperatures expected to climb above 40 degrees Celsius (104 Fahrenheit) in the days ahead, according to the weather department.
articles.title: Bangladesh reopens schools amid scorching heatwave

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: World Central Kitchen (WCK) said it would resume operations in the Gaza Strip on Monday, a month after seven workers of the U.S.-based charity were killed in an Israeli air strike.
articles.title: World Central Kitchen to resume Gaza aid after staff deaths in Israeli strike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The amount of humanitarian aid going into the Gaza Strip will be ramped up in the coming days, Israel's military said on Sunday.
articles.title: Israel will 'scale up' amount of aid going into Gaza, military says

articles.author: Rich Mckay
articles.description: Pro-Palestinian protests at U.S. universities showed no sign of slowing as they spread coast-to-coast over the weekend and police crackdowns and arrests continued into another week while students vowed to stay in tent encampments until their demands are met.
articles.title: Pro-Palestinian protests keep roiling US college campuses

articles.author: Jennifer Rigby
articles.description: Success in the fight to wipe out polio is not guaranteed, according to tech billionaire turned philanthropist Bill Gates, whose foundation has poured billions into the effort.
articles.title: Wiping out polio 'not guaranteed', support needed, Bill Gates says
